Subjective: 1.5-week history of lower back pain radiating down right leg, posterior thigh, and lateral lower leg to foot; worse on right side. Taking paracetamol and ibuprofen without relief. Unable to work or exercise; trouble sleeping. Decreased sensation and tingling on right lower leg. No bowel/bladder dysfunction. Request: Pain relief; concerned about surgery.
Objective: No fever. Right leg: decreased sensation; positive straight leg raise test. Strength normal. Reflexes intact. No muscle atrophy.
Assessment: Lumbosacral radicular syndrome, likely lumbar disc herniation. No signs of cauda equina syndrome.
Plan: Start pregabalin 75mg twice daily, titrate as needed.
Advise activity modification: avoid heavy lifting.
Safety net: Seek immediate care if bowel/bladder changes or leg weakness occur.
